result.execSummary:
The defendant Skyler Thorne-Grays was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Skyler Thorne-Grays is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Skyler Thorne-Grays was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
While incarcerated 25% of the inmate funds shall be applied to outstanding financial obligations.

Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program after serving one year of sentence.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: AODA evaluation and comply as deemed necessary.

Counseling deemed necessary.

No contact with co-defendants, A.B., M.B. and M.H.

Absolute sobriety.   Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol and drugs.

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

3:17 Defendant Skyler Thorne-Grays in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant Skyler Thorne-Grays in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives preliminary hearing and enters plea of not guilty. Attorney Kryshak requests that bond be amended to $1100 cash and she has a local address. State does not object.
Court amends bond to $1100.00 cash bond with the condition of do not leave the State of Wisconsin and absolute sobriety.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
